_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Airgas East facility located in Bladensburg, MD manufactures, packages and distributes Acetylene gas. Acetylene is stored on site in quantities that exceed the Threshold Quantity for Acetylene. (Defined in Part 68.130 of the EPA Risk Management Program Rule)



The facility stores cylinders of Chlorine for redistribution. This product is stored in quantities that exceed the Threshold Quantities. (Defined in Part 68.130 of the EPA Risk Management Program Rule)



The facility does store Propane for the purposes of retail sale. This is exempt from the rule.



The Worst Case release scenario for the Acetylene process did affect the public. There are public receptors within the distance to the end point from a worst case release scenario.The Acetylene manufacturing plant is EPA RMP Program level 3.



The Worst Case Release scenario for the Chlorine storage did affect the public. There are public receptors within the distance to the end point from a worst case release scenario. The Chlorine Storage is in excess of OSHA PSM Threshold Quantity and is therefore a Program Level 3 process.



The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies for the Bladensburg site are located in the Process Safety and Risk Management binders.  Airgas' Process Safety and Risk Management Program provides instructions for implementing processes that produce employee participation, RMP related deliverables, and training activities that are compliant with 40 CFR Part 68.



At the time this Executive Summary was written, the covered process had not been involved with an accidental release that could have lead to property damage, catastrophic consequence, injury, or death within the past 5 years.  In addition, an accidental release had not lead to a response or restoration activity for an exposure of an environmental receptor.  



Employees of the Bladensburg site will not respond to accidental releases of regulated substances.  The facility has an evacuation plan and has c

oordinated emergency response activities with Bladensburg, MD fire department.  



The review of the acetylene PHA produced 20+ changes that improved safety.  Please refer to the PSM/RMP Corrective Action/Improvement Log for additional information.  At the time this Executive Summary was written, there were no additional plans for improvement.  Future improvements will be summarized on the PSM/RMP Corrective Action/Improvement Log.
